stringTriggers.name: @mrn
stringTriggers.description: Medical Reference Number for patient

stringTriggers.name: @patient
stringTriggers.description: Basic patient information (e.g. Debra Hernandez672 is a 51 year old female)

stringTriggers.name: @age
stringTriggers.description: Patient's age in years as of today

stringTriggers.name: @gender
stringTriggers.description: Patientâ€™s gender classification for administrative purposes (may differ from biological, clinical, or gender identity)

stringTriggers.name: @dateofbirth
stringTriggers.description: Patient's date of birth in DD.MMM.YYYY format (e.g., 5 APR 1966)

stringTriggers.name: @name
stringTriggers.description: Patient's given and family name

name: staging

stringTriggers.name: #staging
stringTriggers.description: The stage of a cancer, assessed according to the standard established by American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC). TNM Stage Grouping categorizes the progression of cancer using the Roman Numeral system.

description: The stage of a cancer, assessed according to the standard established by American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC). TNM Stage Grouping categorizes the progression of cancer using the Roman Numeral system.
Describes the original (primary) tumor.
Describes the degree to which the cancer has reached nearby lymph nodes.
Whether or not the cancer has spread to other parts of the body.

name: disease status

stringTriggers.name: #disease status
stringTriggers.description: Determination of disease status is based on a number of complex variables which include objective measures like tumor growth, symptomatic criteria, patient reports information, and subjective evaluations.

structuredPhrase: #disease status${% is #${status}}${% based on #${reasons}}${% relative to #reference date #${referenceDateDate}}${% #as of #${asOfDateDate}}
description: Determination of disease status is based on a number of complex variables which include objective measures like tumor growth, symptomatic criteria, patient reports information, and subjective evaluations.
Based on on the patient data available to the clinician at the time of evaluation.
Rationale for the choice of status.

name: as of

stringTriggers.name: #as of
stringTriggers.description: The date as of when the disease status was assessed.

description: The date as of when the disease status was assessed.

name: reference date

stringTriggers.name: #reference date
stringTriggers.description: The date relative to which the diseases status is assessed.

description: The date relative to which the diseases status is assessed.

name: toxicity

stringTriggers.name: #toxicity
stringTriggers.description: Side effects to treatment, important for effective evaluation of disease and treatment, based on Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 4.03 (June 14, 2010).

description: Side effects to treatment, important for effective evaluation of disease and treatment, based on Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 4.03 (June 14, 2010).
The severity of the adverse event. The CTCAE displays Grades 1 through 5 with unique clinical descriptions of severity for each adverse event.

Any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.
The relationship of the event or cause to the adverse event.

name: clinical trial

stringTriggers.name: #clinical trial
stringTriggers.description: Support specifying the enrollment or end date for the patient in a clinical trial.

description: Support specifying the enrollment or end date for the patient in a clinical trial.

name: enrolled on

stringTriggers.name: #enrolled on
stringTriggers.description: The date the patient was enrolled in the clinical trial.

description: The date the patient was enrolled in the clinical trial.

name: ended on

stringTriggers.name: #ended on
stringTriggers.description: The date when the patient's involvement in clinical trial ended.

description: The date when the patient's involvement in clinical trial ended.

name: deceased

stringTriggers.name: #deceased
stringTriggers.description: An indication that the person is no longer living, given by a date

description: An indication that the person is no longer living as of the specified date.

stringTriggers.name: #date
stringTriggers.description: A date

description: Allows entry of a date.

stringTriggers.name: #title
stringTriggers.description: Pick list for clinical trial

description: Allows selection of the clinical trial.

stringTriggers.name: @condition
stringTriggers.description: Select a condition of the patient to insert and support capturing further information about.

stringTriggers.name: @procedure
stringTriggers.description: Select a procedure of the patient to insert and support capturing further information about.

stringTriggers.name: @medication
stringTriggers.description: Select a medication of the patient to insert and support capturing further information about.

stringTriggers.name: @stage
stringTriggers.description: Stage of cancer based on AJCC

name: ER

stringTriggers.name: #ER
stringTriggers.description: Estrogen receptors (ERs) are a group of proteins found inside cells. They are receptors that are activated by the hormone estrogen. Estrogen receptors may be found in breast cancer cells (ER positive). Cancer cells with these receptors depend on estrogen to grow.

description: Estrogen receptors (ERs) are a group of proteins found inside cells. They are receptors that are activated by the hormone estrogen. Estrogen receptors may be found in breast cancer cells (ER positive). Cancer cells with these receptors depend on estrogen to grow.

stringTriggers.name: #Positive
stringTriggers.description: Presence of hormone receptors in cancerous cells (for  ER or PR) or high-levels of the growth-promoting protein (e.g. HER2)

stringTriggers.name: #Negative
stringTriggers.description: Hormone receptors not present in cancerous cells (for ER or PR) or levels of growth-promoting hormone (e.g., HER2) are low.

name: PR

stringTriggers.name: #PR
stringTriggers.description: The progesterone receptor (PR) is a protein found inside cells. It is activated by the steroid hormone progesterone. Progesterone receptors may be found in breast cancer cells (PR positive). Cancer cells with these receptors depend on progesterone to grow.

description: The progesterone receptor (PR) is a protein found inside cells. It is activated by the steroid hormone progesterone. Progesterone receptors may be found in breast cancer cells (PR positive). Cancer cells with these receptors depend on progesterone to grow.

name: HER2

stringTriggers.name: #HER2
stringTriggers.description: Human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 (HER2) is a protein involved in normal cell growth. It is found on some types of cancer cells (HER2 positive), including breast and ovarian. Cancer cells removed from the body may be tested for the presence of human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 to help decide the best type of treatment.

description: Human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 (HER2) is a protein involved in normal cell growth. It is found on some types of cancer cells (HER2 positive), including breast and ovarian. Cancer cells removed from the body may be tested for the presence of human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 to help decide the best type of treatment.

stringTriggers.name: @allergies
stringTriggers.description: Insert a summary of patient allergies

stringTriggers.name: @all medications
stringTriggers.description: Insert a summary of patient medications

stringTriggers.name: @active medications
stringTriggers.description: Insert a summary of the active (currently being taken) patient medications

stringTriggers.name: @HPI
stringTriggers.description: Insert patient's history of present illness
